articles.title: Probation for man who sexually assaulted 2 girls in his youth group, stalked ex-girlfriend

sentences.content: SINGAPORE: A man sexually assaulted two teenage girls who were part of his youth group when he was 16 years old, taking advantage of one when she was ill and the other as she comforted him.
The man, now 22, had also harassed an ex-girlfriend, threatening to upload her explicit photographs and videos.

The Singaporean man was given 21 months of probation on Thursday (Sep 22) after previously pleading guilty to six charges relating to sexual penetration of a minor under 16, unlawful stalking and threatening to distribute intimate images or recordings.
Another eight charges were considered for his sentencing.
In addition, he will have to perform 60 hours of community service and attend psychological treatment among other conditions.
None of the parties in this case can be named due to a court-imposed gag order.
One of the girls he sexually assaulted was 13 years old then.
The man knew that she had a crush on him.
However, the pair never dated.
He asked this girl home in 2016, claiming that he needed someone to confide his personal problems in.
While in his bedroom, the man began to cry and hugged the victim.
The victim reluctantly hugged him back, believing that she was consoling him.
However, the man abruptly kissed her lips before sexually assaulting her.
“The accused then told (the victim) that he knew (the victim) wanted to have sex with her.
(The victim) told the accused that he was mistaken, because she had not even kissed anyone before the accused had suddenly kissed her without her consent,” court documents read.
Ignoring the girl’s protests, the man pinned her down and sexually assaulted her.
After the incident, the man ignored the girl and treated her coldly.
It dawned on the girl that the man was not interested in a relationship and was only using her to satisfy his lust.
The man also sexually assaulted a 15-year-old girl whom he dated for two months.
They began dating in June 2016 but the girl broke up with him after discovering that he had been cheating on her.
The pair agreed to meet for breakfast one morning in June 2016.
However, the girl came down with a fever.
Instead of cancelling the date, the man got the victim to rest at his home before they went out.
The girl rested on his bed intending to take a nap, but the man sexually assaulted her.
The girl was unable to fend him off in her weak state, court documents stated.
The offences came to light in 2018 when the man shared with his mentor at the youth group that he had had sex with three girls in 2016.
The mentor lodged a police report on May 21, 2018.
The man also harassed an ex-girlfriend and her family.
The two began dating in February 2018 but the girl, whose age was undisclosed, soon came to realise that the man kept texting other girls.
She initiated a breakup but the man would threaten to kill himself.
When those threats lost effect, the man would turn up at the girl’s workplace uninvited.
Even when the girl left for an overseas internship in 2019, the man would harass her colleagues and family members when she did not respond to his messages.

"In his messages to her colleagues and family members, the accused threatened to repeatedly call (the victim’s) office and make sure that she would not be able to do her work, or even falsely informed her colleagues that (the victim) was either skipping work or even resigning.

“The accused also cast aspersions on (the victim’s) character by sending profanity-laden messages ... To cause further alarm, the accused also threatened to make a police report on the false allegation that (the victim) was being harassed by her male boss.”
In 2020, the girl broke up with the man but lodged a police report after the man threatened to expose her compromising photos and videos online.
The man had refused to delete them after the relationship ended.
The victim felt alarmed as she had found out that the man was a member of the SG Nasi Lemak Telegram group that shared obscene media of women.

articles.event: Sexual assault and harassment
articles.outcome: The man was given 21 months of probation, 60 hours of community service, and psychological treatment among other conditions.

articles.title: Youth gets 21 months' probation for forcing girls as young as 13 to have sex with him, stalking ex-girlfriend

sentences.content: SINGAPORE — At the age of 16, he made three teenage girls have sex with him.
One of them was only 13 while another was unwell and running a fever at the time.
A couple of years later, when he was in a relationship, his girlfriend noticed him texting other girls on the phone.
She wanted to break up with him but he frequently threatened to kill himself if she left him.
He then began turning up at her home or workplace, lied to her colleagues that she was skipping work and harassed her relatives.
He did not stop even when they finally ended their relationship.
In 2020, he threatened to publish her explicit photos and videos online if she did not unblock him on social media and change her Instagram profile picture.
For his actions spanning four years, the Singaporean youth, now aged 22, was on Thursday (Sept 22) ordered to undergo 21 months’ probation.
He cannot be named because he committed some of the offences when he was under 18.
The Children and Young Persons Act bans the publication of the identities of young offenders.
He earlier pleaded guilty to four charges of sexual penetration of a minor, along with one charge each of unlawful stalking and threatening to distribute intimate recordings.
He did not face any charges of rape or sexual assault.

HAS 'STRONG FAMILIAL SUPPORT'

On Thursday, Deputy Public Prosecutor Louis Ngia told the court that he “did not object” to probation being meted out in line with the probation officer’s recommendation.

“While we maintain that the offences are rather serious ones, we have taken into account the fact that (the youth) appears to have strong familial support and most of the offences were committed at a very young age of 16 years old,” the prosecutor added.
The youth’s lawyer Riko Isaac said that his client was willing to comply with the terms of probation.
District Judge Janet Wang ultimately imposed the community-based sentence, but she cautioned that the courts are not bound to follow the recommendations of probation officers.
Probation is usually offered to first-time offenders between 16 and 21 years old.
This does not result in a recorded criminal conviction and allows young offenders to continue with their education or employment while serving their sentences.
As part of his probation conditions, the youth has to perform 60 hours of community service, and he has to remain indoors from midnight to 6am.
He also has to attend psychological treatment and allow his probation officer to monitor and check his internet devices.
His parents posted a bond of S$5,000 to ensure his good behaviour during the probation period.

FIRST TWO VICTIMS

Court documents detailed his offences against two girls — then aged 13 and 15 — as well as his ex-girlfriend.
The younger girl had developed feelings for him but they never got into a relationship.
On one occasion, she followed him home when he claimed that he wanted to confide in someone about his personal problems.
They went into his bedroom because his grandmother was also home.
He began to cry while confiding in her, before suddenly kissing her on the lips and forcing himself on her.
She pushed him away and tried to protest.
However, he told her that he knew she wanted to have sex with him, before holding her down on the bed to have his way with her.
After the sexual acts, she left in a confused and emotionally fragile state.
Unsure if she was now in a relationship with him, she sent him text messages.
He gave curt replies before eventually ignoring her.
The girl later realised that he was not interested in dating her, and was upset that he had used her against her will to satisfy his sexual desires, the court heard.
As for the 15-year-old girl, she began dating him in June 2016.
She went over to his home one day when he suggested that she rest at his place before they went on a date.
She was running a fever then.
Feeling very tired and ill, she complied when he asked her to go to his bedroom, thinking she could take a short nap there.
When she closed her eyes, he began touching her chest before engaging in sexual acts with her.
She was too weak and powerless to resist, eventually giving him and letting him have his way.
They broke up two months later when she found out that he was cheating on her.
These offences came to light in May 2018 after he told a youth worker about having sexual intercourse with three girls when he was 16.

HARASSED EX-GIRLFRIEND

Separately, the youth began dating another girl in early 2018 after meeting her in school.
Their relationship was “emotionally distressing” for her from the start, the court heard.
Four months later, she began telling him that she wanted to break up with him because she often saw him texting many girls.
He then threatened to kill himself.
When these threats stopped working, he resorted to other methods such as going to her home in the early hours of the morning.
In June 2019, she left for a few months for an internship in Vietnam.
During this period, noticing that she did not respond to his messages, he threatened to contact her colleagues in Vietnam.
When she did not accede to his threats, he sent messages to her colleagues and family members over Facebook Messenger in order to make her respond to him.
He threatened to repeatedly call her office, lied to her colleagues that she was skipping work or resigning, and threatened to make a false police report that her male boss was harassing her.
Because of this, she felt compelled to not have lunch with male colleagues on his demands.
They eventually broke up in February 2020 but he continued asking her to get back together.
Things came to a head on May 15, 2020.
This was during the Covid-19 circuit breaker period here when people were not allowed to leave their homes save for essential purposes.
He told her he was preparing to post her explicit photos and videos online unless she unblocked him on social media and changed her Instagram display picture.
She had told him to delete the lewd material, which he recorded while they were dating, but he refused.
When she did not give in to his demands, he forwarded her one of the videos.
She was particularly alarmed by this because she knew he belonged to the Telegram chat group “SG Nasi Lemak”, where members shared obscene material of Singaporean women.
She filed a police report — the second one after she went to the police in September 2019.
Adult offenders convicted of sexually penetrating a minor under 14 can be jailed for up to 20 years, and fined or caned.
The punishment for the same offence against a minor under 16 is imprisonment of up to 10 years or a fine, or both.

articles.event: Harassment and sexual offenses
articles.outcome: Probation for 21 months, 60 hours of community service, and other conditions.

articles.title: 新加坡科学家开发出血液检测试剂盒，可在10分钟内检测出对COVID-19的免疫力

sentences.content: 新加坡:新加坡的一个科学家团队开发了一种血液检测试剂盒，可以在10分钟内判断一个人是否对COVID-19具有免疫力，准确率高达93%。
该工具包由新加坡-麻省理工学院研究与技术联盟(SMART)和南洋理工大学(NTU)的一个团队开发。SMART是麻省理工学院在新加坡的研究企业。
SMART和南大在周四(9月22日)的一份联合新闻稿中说，该试剂盒需要一滴血，可以在10分钟内检测出一个人是否有针对SARS-CoV-2(导致COVID-19的病毒)的抗体，而传统的实验室检测需要24到72小时。
科学家们表示，这种检测试剂盒可以在未来“很容易地适应”新的担忧变种和其他疾病，并将其描述为“低成本”的检测。
该测试可以由未经医学培训的人员进行，不需要任何专门的实验室设备。新闻稿称，这将为“对老年人等弱势人群进行大规模检测”铺平道路。
科学家们表示，该检测试剂盒基于在血液样本中检测到的抗体来检测COVID-19免疫力。这与抗原快速检测试剂盒不同，后者寻找COVID-19感染期间产生的病毒蛋白质的存在。
根据测试中检测到的抗体，这可以告诉患者在注射增强剂之前应该对潜在感染保持多谨慎，以及何时应该服用增强剂。
研究人员说:“这为个性化疫苗接种策略铺平了道路，人们只在必要时接种疫苗和强化针，这取决于他们的抗体水平和免疫反应的差异。”
截至周二，新加坡93%的人口已经完成了完整的疫苗接种方案。大约80%的人口已经接受了加强注射。
SMART和南洋理工大学表示，该测试套件的进一步开发正在进行中，以满足必要的监管批准和公共使用的制造标准。
SMART公司负责测试套件的团队已经成立了一家名为Thrixen的初创公司，该公司正在将这种测试开发成可商用的产品。

articles.event: Development of a blood test kit
articles.who: A team of scientists from SMART and Nanyang Technological University (NTU)
articles.outcome: The blood test kit can detect COVID-19 immunity in 10 minutes with a 93% accuracy rate, and can be easily adapted to detect new strains and other diseases.

articles.title: Saintis S'pura cipta kit uji darah bagi kesan imuniti terhadap COVID-19 dalam 10 minit

sentences.content: SINGAPURA: Sekumpulan saintis di Singapura berjaya menghasilkan kit ujian darah yang berupaya mengetahui sama ada seseorang mempunyai imuniti terhadap COVID-19 dalam masa 10 minit, dengan tahap ketepatan sehingga 93 peratus.

Kit tersebut dibangunkan oleh pasukan dari Perikatan Singapura-MIT bagi Penyelidikan dan Teknologi (SMART) dan Universiti Teknologi Nanyang (NTU). SMART adalah perusahaan penyelidikan Institut Teknologi Massachusetts di Singapura.

Kit tersebut memerlukan hanya setitik darah dan berupaya mengesan sama ada seseorang itu mempunyai antibodi bagi melawan SARS-CoV-2 - virus yang menyebabkan COVID-19 - dalam masa 10 minit, berbanding 24 hingga 72 jam yang diperlukan bagi ujian makmal konvensional, menurut SMART dan NTU dalam satu kenyataan bersama pada Khamis (22 Sep).
Ujian ini "mudah untuk disesuaikan" bagi varian-varian baru dan penyakit-penyakit lain pada masa akan datang, kmenurut para saintis, yang turut menyifatkan ujian tersebut sebagai "rendah kosnya".
Ujian itu boleh dilakukan oleh seseorang tanpa latihan perubatan dan tidak memerlukan sebarang peralatan di makmal.
Ini akan membuka laluan kepada "ujian berskala besar bagi kumpulan-kumpulan yang mudah terdedah," seperti warga tua, menurut kenyataan media tersebut.

Kit ujian itu berupaya mengesan imuniti terhadap COVID-19 berdasarkan antibodi yang dikesan pada sampel darah, kata para saintis. Ini berbeza dengan ujian ART yang mengesan kehadiran protein yang dihasilkan apabila seseorang terkena jangkitan COVID-19.

Melalui antibodi yang dikesan menerusi ujian tersebut, ia boleh memaklumkan seseorang tentang betapa mereka harus berhati-hati terhadap potensi dijangkiti sebelum mendapatkan suntikan dos penggalak dan bila suntikan dos penggalak itu patut diambil.
Pasukan dari SMART yang menghasilkan kit ujian tersebut juga sudah menubuhkan Thrixen, sebuah syarikat pemula yang sedang membangunkan ujian itu sebagai produk yang boleh dipasarkan.

articles.event: Development of a blood test kit for COVID-19
articles.who: A team of scientists in Singapore
articles.outcome: The kit can detect COVID-19 antibodies in just 10 minutes with an accuracy of up to 93% and can be easily adapted for future variants and diseases.

articles.title: Saintis S'pura bangun kit ujian darah pantas tentukan kekuatan tubuh lawan Covid-19

sentences.content: HANYA menggunakan setitik darah daripada tusukan jari, satu kit ujian darah pantas baru yang dibangunkan oleh saintis di Singapura boleh menentukan sama ada tubuh seseorang itu mempunyai kekuatan melawan penyakit Covid-19 dan variannya.
Ujian mengambil masa hanya 10 minit untuk menunjukkan keputusan, berbanding dengan 24 hingga 72 jam yang diperlukan untuk ujian makmal konvensional.
Kit ujian itu dibangunkan oleh pasukan saintis dari Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology (Smart), syarikat penyelidikan MIT di Singapura, dan Universiti Teknologi Nanyang (NTU).

Smart dan NTU, dalam satu kenyataan media, semalam, berkata kit itu boleh mengesan tahap neutral antibodi terhadap Sars-CoV-2, virus yang menyebabkan Covid-19, dan variannya, seperti Delta dan Omicron.
Ujian itu, yang menggunakan ujian berasaskan kertas yang disalut dengan bahan kimia yang mengikat antibodi dalam sampel darah, mempunyai ketepatan sehingga 93 peratus, kata kedua-dua institusi itu.
Ia boleh disesuaikan dengan mudah bagi varian dan penyakit lain pada masa hadapan, tambahnya.
Ujian itu juga boleh dilakukan oleh seseorang tanpa latihan perubatan kerana ia tidak memerlukan penggunaan peralatan makmal khusus.

articles.event: Development of a rapid blood test for detecting antibodies against COVID-19 and its variants
articles.who: Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology (Smart) and Nanyang Technological University (NTU)
articles.outcome: The rapid blood test, which takes only 10 minutes to provide results, has an accuracy of up to 93% and can be adapted for future variants and diseases.

articles.title: Singapore scientists develop blood test kit to detect immunity against COVID-19 in 10 minutes

sentences.content: SINGAPORE: A team of scientists in Singapore has developed a blood test kit that can tell if a person has immunity against COVID-19 in 10 minutes, with up to 93 per cent accuracy.
The kit was developed by a team from the Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology (SMART) and Nanyang Technological University (NTU).
SMART is the Massachusetts Institute of Technology’s research enterprise in Singapore.

The kit requires a drop of blood and can detect if a person has antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 – the virus that causes COVID-19 – in 10 minutes, compared with 24 to 72 hours needed for conventional laboratory testing, said SMART and NTU in a joint news release on Thursday (Sep 22).
The test kit can be “easily adapted” for new variants of concern and other diseases in the future, the scientists said, describing the test as “low cost”.
The test can be administered by a person without medical training and does not require any specialised laboratory equipment.
This will pave the way for "large-scale testing of vulnerable subsets of the population", such as the elderly, said the news release.

articles.event: Development of a blood test kit
articles.who: A team of scientists from the Singapore-MIT Alliance for Research and Technology (SMART) and Nanyang Technological University (NTU)
articles.outcome: A blood test kit that can tell if a person has immunity against COVID-19 in 10 minutes, with up to 93% accuracy. The kit requires a drop of blood and can detect if a person has antibodies against SARS-CoV-2 – the virus that causes COVID-19 – in 10 minutes, compared with 24 to 72 hours needed for conventional laboratory testing. The test can be administered by a person without medical training and does not require any specialised laboratory equipment. This will pave the way for "large-scale testing of vulnerable subsets of the population", such as the elderly.

articles.title: Lelaki dipenjara seumur hidup, tikam rakan sebilik

sentences.content: SINGAPURA: Selepas bergaduh dengan rakan sebiliknya gara-gara tabiat lelaki itu yang boros berbelanja, Naing Lin, seorang warga Myanmar pergi ke dapur untuk menyediakan makanan. Namun, dia kemudian menggunakan pisau memasak, untuk menikam rakan sebiliknya itu.

Lelaki 51 tahun itu dalam keadaan mabuk ketika menghayunkan pisau ke arah rakan senegaranya Myo Kyaw Thu, menikam lelaki itu beberapa kali di bahagian dada dan perut. Kejadian tersebut berlaku di flat mereka di Bedok Reservoir Road pada 2 April, 2021.
Naing Lin kemudian meninggalkan flat tersebut dan tidak pulang hingga keesokan pagi di mana dia melihat keadaan mangsa berlumuran darah di bilik tidur.
Naing Lin dijatuhi hukuman penjara seumur hidup pada Khamis (22 Sep) selepas mengaku bersalah atas satu tuduhan membunuh.
Mahkamah diberitahu bahawa mangsa, 49 tahun, ialah seorang teknisyen kanan di Singapura dan berada di sini menggunakan pas lawatan jangka pendek ketika kematiannya.
Pada petang sebelum kejadian itu, kedua-dua lelaki telah keluar bersama teman mereka untuk minum arak. Naing Lin minum lima hingga tujuh tin bir.
Mereka pulang berasingan ke bilik sewa mereka di Bedok Reservoir Road.
BERTENGKAR SEBAB TABIAT BELANJA

Apabila Naing Lin masuk ke bilik tidur mereka, dia ternampak Myo Kyaw Thu sedang duduk di atas katilnya sambil menggunakan telefon bimbit. Mereka mula bertengkar tentang tabiat mangsa yang boros berbelanja.

Penilaian dari Institut Kesihatan Mental mendapati Naing Lin sedang mabuk ketika kejadian itu namun dia tidak menghidap gangguan mental, kurang upaya intelektual atau kurang siuman. Keadaannya itu tidak menyebabkan Niang kurang sedar apa yang dilakukannya itu adalah salah.
Bagi kesalahan membunuh, Naing Lin boleh dihukum mati, namun Hakim Valerie Thean mendapati fakta kes tersebut tidak menghendakinya dihukum mati.

articles.event: Murder
articles.outcome: Sentenced to life imprisonment on September 22, 2022

articles.title: Life imprisonment for man who stabbed roommate after fight over spending habits

sentences.content: SINGAPORE: After an argument over his roommate’s spending habits, a man went to prepare some food but ended up stabbing his roommate with the knife he meant to cut ingredients with.

Naing Lin, a 51-year-old Myanmar national, was intoxicated when he swung his knife at compatriot Myo Kyaw Thu, stabbing him several times in his chest and abdomen in their flat at Bedok Reservoir Road on Apr 2, 2021.
In the afternoon before the incident, both men had a drinking session with friends.
Naing Lin had five to seven large cans of beer.
The pair returned separately to the room they shared at Bedok Reservoir Road.
Myo Kyaw Thu retorted that he would settle his own issues without asking Naing Lin for money.
At this point, according to the prosecution, Naing Lin left for the kitchen, wanting to fry an egg with onions.
He picked up a kitchen knife and was preparing to cook when he realised he did not have his phone with him.
He continued stabbing his roommate in his chest, abdomen and upper left arm, causing the victim to collapse.
Naing Lin then changed his clothes, took his mobile phone and wallet and left the unit at about 6.20pm, without checking on his roommate.
Over the next few hours, Naing Lin contacted several friends and asked them to get in touch with the victim.
Naing Lin also tried to call and text Myo Kyaw Thu.
Accompanied by a friend, Naing Lin finally made his way back to the unit at around 9.20am the next day.
He initially remained in the lorry he was driving while the friend tried to enter the flat and called out to the victim.

Describing Naing Lin’s remorse, his lawyers Sanjiv Rajan and Minn Naing Oo cited a portion of their client’s statement to the police where he said: “I should have called for the ambulance, then my friend would not have died.
"In my moment of drunk state and confusion, I left the house and drove away.
I am very sad about what happened.
I did not plan or expect this.
He is a close friend and drinking buddy.
Although we have disagreements I mean no harm to him.
This was accidental.”

Noting that Naing Lin would be missing the formative years of his son in Myanmar, Mr Sanjiv said: “Hopefully we can move on a trajectory that gives my client some hope or some prospect … of being reunited with his family one day.”

articles.event: Stabbing incident
articles.who: Naing Lin and Myo Kyaw Thu
articles.outcome: Myo Kyaw Thu died due to the stab wounds.

articles.title: 替大马人代考驾驶理论 狮城中国籍男子被识破判监2个月

sentences.content: 一名在新加坡当司机的中国籍男子在微信上看到找人代考新加坡基本驾驶理论的广告，为赚取200元（新币，下同），他答应帮一名素未谋面的马来西亚籍男子顶包代考，结果工作人员检查证件时，当场识破2人的计谋。
《联合早报》报道，法官下判时同意控方立场，认为刑罚有必要起到阻遏他人犯下类似的罪行，以确保其他公路使用者的安全，但考虑被告是初犯和及早认罪，最终判他坐牢2个月。这名被告是来自中国的张忠良（28岁），他案发时在新加坡当一名司机。他昨天承认一项企图冒充他人身份欺骗的控状。
根据案情，马来西亚籍吴阿福（51岁）案发时是一名建筑工人，他原本驾驶马来西亚注册的摩托车，但他打算长期在新加坡工作，因此有意在新加坡购买摩托车，并将马来西亚驾照转换为新加坡驾照。
转换成新加坡驾照的条件是须通过基本驾驶理论，但吴阿福没有把握能通过考试。他后来通过同事介绍找上一名“中介”，后者会帮忙安排他人代考，并收取500元费用。
另一方面，张忠良通过微信看到帮人代考可赚取200元的广告，他为了赚快钱主动联系打广告的“中介”，并答应帮忙代考。6月28日，吴阿福按约定到兀兰的新加坡安全驾驶中心与“中介”会面，他交付500元和工作准证后，就到附近咖啡店等候。张忠良当天也在安全驾驶中心外头，从“中介”手中接过吴阿福的工作准证。中介当时告诉他，事成后才可以取得200元。

当天早上9时，张忠良代替吴阿福到中心报考，他听到工作人员高喊吴阿福的名字后，上前交出吴阿福的准证。不过，工作人员指示张忠良拉下口罩，以便核实身份，结果他发现张忠良与准证上的照片不同，而且张忠良也讲不出吴阿福的身份证号码。早已心存怀疑的工作人员，于是要求张忠良提供其他文件证实身份。无计可施的张忠良只好离开，随后带着吴阿福回到中心，工作人员接着报警处理。张忠良求情时称，他对自己的行为悔不当初，他恳请法官轻判，让他可以尽快回国与妻子和2个孩子团聚。吴阿福原定同天认罪，但他在庭上表现出踌躇不安的样子，法官于是将他的案件展期至8月25日进行审前会议。而涉案的“中介”则无法确认身份。（人名译音）

articles.event: A man from China was found guilty of impersonating another person to cheat on a driving theory test in Singapore.
articles.outcome: The man was sentenced to two months in prison.

articles.title: Man who paid S$500 to have someone else take basic theory test on his behalf gets jail

sentences.content: SINGAPORE: Worried that he would fail his basic theory test for a driving licence, a Malaysian man hired someone else to do it for him.
Goh Ah Hock’s ruse came to light when the tester asked the imposter to remove his mask and noticed that the imposter’s face looked different from the photo on Goh’s work permit.

Goh, 52, was jailed for two months on Thursday (Sep 22), after pleading guilty to abetting the offence of cheating by personation with Zhang Zhongliang, who had been hired to take the basic theory test.
The incident took place at the Singapore Safety Driving Centre (SSDC) at 2 Woodlands Industrial Park E4 in June.
Zhang was jailed for two months on Jul 21 for the offence of attempted cheating.
The court heard that Goh formed the impression that the use of foreign vehicles in Singapore would be banned in July.
To do so, Goh needed to take the basic theory test, but he was not confident of passing it.
Instead, Goh decided to engage an unidentified agent through his colleague to facilitate the conversion of the driving licence.
In return, he would pay S$500.
On Jun 28 this year, Goh met and paid the agent S$500 outside SSDC.
Goh was informed someone would take the test on his behalf and was asked to hand over his work permit.
He then left to wait at a coffeeshop.
Meanwhile, Zhang, a 28-year-old Chinese national, had been hired after he responded to a WeChat advertisement to take the test on behalf of another person for S$200.
He met the agent outside SSDC, and was instructed to take the test on Goh’s behalf.
Upon completion, Zhang was supposed to meet the agent outside SSDC to receive his payment.
At around 9am on Jun 28, Zhang entered the holding room to wait for his turn for the test.
The tester called out Goh’s name and Zhang replied, before presenting Goh’s work permit as his own.
The tester then asked Zhang to take off his mask and noticed that he looked different from the photo on the permit.
Zhang was also unable to state Goh’s FIN number upon request.
Goh’s lawyer Lim Kim Song argued for one month’s jail for his client, submitting that his culpability was lower than Zhang’s.
According to the lawyer, Zhang was playing the active role while Goh was “passive”.
For cheating by personation, Zhang could have been jailed for up to five years, or fined, or both.

articles.event: Abetting cheating by personation
articles.where: Singapore Safety Driving Centre (SSDC) at 2 Woodlands Industrial Park E4
articles.outcome: Goh Ah Hock was jailed for two months.

articles.title: Ahli perniagaan Malaysia ‘Fat Leonard’ ditahan di Venezuela

sentences.content: NEW YORK: Seorang ahli perniagaan warga Malaysia yang sebelum ini melarikan diri daripada tahanan rumah sejak lebih dua minggu lalu selepas terlibat dalam skandal rasuah besar membabitkan Tentera Laut Amerika Syarikat (AS) dilaporkan ditahan di Venezuela.

Portal berita NBC News melaporkan, Leonard Glenn Francis atau dikenali sebagai ‘Fat Leonard’ yang berasal dari Pulau Pinang ditahan kelmarin oleh pihak berkuasa Venezuela selepas menerima maklumat dari Polis Antarabangsa (Interpol).
Jurucakap pihak berkuasa AS memaklumkan, Francis ditahan ketika cuba menaiki pesawat untuk melarikan diri ke negara lain.
Setakat ini, lelaki itu akan terus ditahan di Venezuela sementara menunggu pihak berkuasa AS melakukan proses ekstradisi.
Francis dilaporkan memotong gelang peranti pemantauannya sebelum melarikan diri dari kediamannya di San Diego.

articles.event: Arrest of a Malaysian businessman
articles.who: Leonard Glenn Francis, also known as 'Fat Leonard'
articles.outcome: Francis will remain in Venezuela while awaiting extradition to the United States.

articles.title: Ahli perniagaan Malaysia 'Fat Leonard' ditahan di Venezuela

sentences.content: NEW YORK: Ahli perniagaan warga Malaysia, Leonard Glenn Francis atau dikenali sebagai 'Fat Leonard' yang melarikan diri daripada tahanan rumah di San Diego, awal bulan ini, ditahan di Venezuela pagi kelmarin.

Menurut Perkhidmatan Marsyal Amerika Syarikat (AS), lelaki yang mendalangi skandal sogokan dan rasuah terbesar dalam sejarah Tentera Laut Amerika Syarikat (AS) itu ditahan ketika cuba menaiki pesawat di lapangan terbang antarabangsa Caracas.

Pegawai kanan Polis Antarabangsa (INTERPOL) di Venezuela memaklumkan, Francis yang berasal dari Pulau Pinang sedang dalam perjalanan menuju ke Russia selepas melalui Mexico dan Cuba, sebelum ditahan di Lapangan Terbang Antarabangsa Simón Bolívar di ibu negara Venezuela.
Setakat ini, Francis akan terus ditahan di Venezuela sementara menunggu pihak berkuasa AS melakukan proses ekstradisi, menurut portal NBC News.
Timbalan Penyelia Marsyal AS, Omar Castillo, berkata penahanan itu dibuat selepas Interpol mengeluarkan notis merah, iaitu permohonan oleh pihak berkuasa untuk mengesan dan menahan seseorang.
Francis melarikan diri daripada tahanan rumah pada 4 September lalu selepas memotong gelang peranti pemantauannya, sebelum menjadi sasaran buruan pihak berkuasa antarabangsa sejak itu.
Sebelum ini, Perkhidmatan Siasatan Jenayah Tentera Laut AS menawarkan hadiah AS$40,000 (RM183,000) untuk maklumat yang membawa kepada penangkapannya.
Peguam Francis, Devin Burstein enggan memberi sebarang komen. Jurucakap Pejabat Peguam Negara AS tidak memberi maklum balas segera ketika diminta mengulas tangkapan itu.
Menurut Castillo, Francis kini ditahan pihak berkuasa di Venezuela dan Jabatan Keadilan AS akan mengetuai usaha mengekstradisi lelaki itu.
AS dan Venezuela memiliki perjanjian ekstradisi yang terhad, namun tidak pasti sama ada ketegangan antara kedua-dua negara bakal menyulitkan proses berkenaan.
Berita penahanan Francis dilaporkan sehari sebelum tarikh untuk Francis dijatuhkan hukuman atas kesalahan rasuah dan konspirasi di mahkamah persekutuan San Diego.

Selama lebih 10 tahun, Francis mendalangi pelbagai skim rasuah, di mana pegawai Tentera Laut AS diberi hadiah, wang tunai dan seks, apabila mereka membantu perniagaan perkhidmatan perkapalan Francis, yang mengawal pelabuhan di seluruh Asia Tenggara.
Skim itu merompak sekurang-kurangnya AS$35 juta (RM160 juta) wang pembayar cukai dan membawa kepada sabitan hampir 36 pegawai tentera laut AS.

Francis membuat perjanjian rayuan dengan bersetuju menyerahkan AS$35 juta itu kepada kerajaan AS. Dia membayar AS$5 juta beberapa tahun lalu, sebelum melarikan diri dan masih berhutang AS$30 juta kepada kerajaan.

Sebelum ini, Francis ditahan di sebuah hotel di San Diego dalam satu serbuan pihak berkuasa persekutuan pada 2013. Selepas membuat pengakuan bersalah dan berdepan beberapa masalah kesihatan termasuk kanser buah pinggang, Francis dibebaskan atas faktor kesihatan dan dikenakan tahanan rumah sejak 2018. - AGENSI

articles.event: Arrest of Leonard Glenn Francis (Fat Leonard)
articles.who: Leonard Glenn Francis (Fat Leonard), a Malaysian businessman
articles.when: Early morning of the article's publish date
articles.outcome: Francis was arrested while attempting to board a plane to Russia after passing through Mexico and Cuba. He is currently being held in Venezuela pending extradition to the United States.

articles.title: 涉贿赂潜逃遭美国通缉 马国国防承包商委内瑞拉落网

sentences.content: 遭美国通缉的马来西亚籍国防承包商法兰西斯星期三（9月21日）在委内瑞拉被捕，他当时正准备登上飞往俄罗斯的航班。
这名绰号“胖子伦纳德”的法兰西斯，来自马国槟城，曾经是格伦亚洲海洋防务公司的行政总裁。
总部设在新加坡的这家公司，长期以来在为美国第七舰队，提供添油、拖船与食物补给等服务。

articles.event: Arrest of a Malaysian defense contractor
articles.outcome: Francis was arrested while preparing to board a flight to Russia.

articles.title: 涉美军史上最大贿赂案 “胖子伦纳德”在委内瑞拉被捕

sentences.content: 涉嫌策划美国军事史上最大的贿赂丑闻之一的马来西亚籍国防承包商在软禁期间剪断脚镣潜逃超过两周之后，在委内瑞拉（Venezuela）被逮捕。
美联社报道，美国司法部法警局（USMS）表示，外号“胖子伦纳德”的法兰西斯（Leonard Glenn Francis）周二（20日）早上在委内瑞拉首都加拉加斯（Caracas）机场被捕。他当时正要登机飞往另一个国家。
国际刑警组织委内瑞拉总干事隆登（Carlos Garate Rondon）通过Instagram透露，法兰西斯是从墨西哥入境委内瑞拉，并打算前往俄罗斯。
法兰西斯在2015年认罪，承认以50万美元（约70万新元）贿赂美国海军，以换取项目合约，随后一直被软禁在家中。案件原定在昨天（22日）判刑，但他却在本月4日剪断脚镣逃跑，当局因此悬赏4万美元（约5万6000新元）通缉他。
目前仍无消息他何时会被引渡回美国接受判刑。
根据早前报道，法兰西斯来自马国槟城，曾是新加坡葛伦亚洲海上防卫公司（GDMA）行政总裁的他被控以性贿赂、豪华旅行等方式贿赂美国海军官员，以换取政府合约。他还报大数，从美国海军那里赚了3500万美元（近5000万新元）。
法兰西斯患有肾癌等健康问题，并且与检方合作，因此在2018年获准软禁在家接受医疗护理。在他的帮助下，检方将34名被告中的33人定罪，其中包括20多名海军军官。

articles.event: Arrest of a Malaysian defense contractor
articles.who: Leonard Glenn Francis, also known as "Fat Leonard"
articles.outcome: Francis was arrested at the Caracas airport while attempting to board a flight to another country.

articles.title: Malaysian fugitive 'Fat Leonard' in massive navy bribery case caught in Venezuela

sentences.content: SAN DIEGO: A Malaysian defence contractor nicknamed “Fat Leonard" who orchestrated one of the largest bribery scandals in US military history has been arrested in Venezuela after fleeing before his sentencing, authorities said on Wednesday (Sep 21).

The international manhunt for Leonard Glenn Francis ended with his arrest by Venezuelan authorities on Tuesday morning at the Caracas airport as he was about to board an airplane for another country, the US Marshals Service said.
Interpol Venezuela Director General Carlos Garate Rondon said in a statement posted on Instagram that Francis came to Venezuela from Mexico.
Rondon said he was headed to Russia.
The arrest came on the eve of his scheduled sentencing in a federal court in California for a bribery scheme that lasted more than a decade and involved dozens of US Navy officers.
There was no immediate word on when he might be extradited to the United States.
Francis was under home arrest in San Diego when he cut off his GPS ankle bracelet and escaped on Sep 4.
Ten US agencies searched for Francis and authorities issued a US$40,000 reward for his arrest.
US authorities also issued a red notice, which asks law enforcement worldwide to provisionally arrest someone with the possibility of extradition.
Malaysia and Singapore both have extradition agreements with the United States.

Francis pleaded guilty in 2015 to offering prostitution services, luxury hotels, cigars, gourmet meals and more than US$500,000 in bribes to Navy officials and others to help his Singapore-based ship servicing company, Glenn Defence Marine Asia or GDMA.
Prosecutors said the company overcharged the Navy by at least US$35 million for servicing ships, many of which were routed to ports he controlled in the Pacific.
Francis had been allowed to remain in home confinement to receive medical care while he cooperated with the prosecution.
With his help, prosecutors secured convictions of 33 of 34 defendants, including more than two dozen Navy officers.

articles.event: Arrest of Leonard Glenn Francis
articles.who: Leonard Glenn Francis, also known as "Fat Leonard"
articles.outcome: Francis was arrested by Venezuelan authorities before his scheduled sentencing in a federal court in California for a bribery scheme that lasted more than a decade and involved dozens of US Navy officers.

articles.title: ‘Fat Leonard,’ Fugitive Defense Contractor Convicted in Navy Bribery Case, Arrested in Venezuela

sentences.content: Leonard Glenn Francis, better known as "Fat Leonard," a defense contractor who disappeared weeks before he was set to be sentenced for one of the largest bribery scandals in the nation’s military history, was taken into custody Wednesday in Venezuela, the U.S. Marshals Service confirmed.
Francis was taken into custody by Venezuelan authorities as he was boarding a plane to another country, Marshals Service spokesperson Omar Castillo said.
The U.S. Marshals learned of his arrest from a social media release from Venezuelan authorities.

Carlos Garate Rondon, the Director General of INTERPOL Venezuela who disclosed the arrest in a statement posted Wednesday on Instagram, said Francis flew from Mexico to Ve Cuba, and his final destination was supposed to be Russia.
Francis will be handed over to federal authorities.
There was no immediate word on when he might be extradited to the United States.
Stay informed about local news and weather.
Get the NBC 7 San Diego app for iOS or Android and pick your alerts.
In 2018, before his escape, a judge warned Francis was a flight risk.
NBC 7's Dave Summers has the story.
The arrest came on the eve of his long-awaited sentencing in a federal court in California for a bribery scheme that lasted more than a decade and involved dozens of U.S. Navy officers.
At the sentencing hearing Thursday, U.S. District Court Judge Janis Sammartino announced to the court that Francis was in custody in Venezuela and that a “no bail arrest warrant" had been issued.

Prosecutors asked the court to note that Francis failed to appear at his sentencing hearing as ordered, while defense attorneys notified the court that they would be filing a motion severing their ties with Francis due to an “irreparable break down of the attorney-client relationship.”
The U.S. Attorney's Office declined to comment on what additional charges Francis could face as a result of his flight from the country, nor how the incident might affect his plea deal.

Former federal prosecutor Drew Galvin told NBC 7 by fleeting Francis breached his plea agreement by committing a new crime, violating conditions of his pre-trial release and failing to show up for sentencing.

"By breaching his plea agreement, the government is relieved of all of its obligations under the plea agreement, which means they can recommend any sentence that they want as long as it doesn’t exceed the statutory maximum, and they can also pursue additional criminal charges against him that they hadn’t done previously," Galvin said.
Sammartino set a Dec. 14 status hearing for Francis with the caveat that all parties could meet sooner depending on how events unfold.
The U.S. government faces an uphill challenge returning the fugitive back to American soil from Venezuela.

While the countries have an extradition agreement, the U.S. government doesn’t recognize Nicolas Maduro’s socialist government, has no embassy in the country and has imposed crushing sanctions on the country that has further embittered relations.
Law enforcement cooperation between the two countries is rare.
Francis has been missing since Sept. 4, when he escaped from home custody in San Diego after cutting off his ankle monitoring bracelet, according to the U.S. Marshals Service
Neighbors reported seeing U-Haul trucks coming and going from the home days before he disappeared.
Last Friday, the U.S. government posted a $40,000 reward last for information leading to the arrest of the Malaysian defense contractor.
Ten U.S. agencies were searching for Francis.
The towering man with a wide girth and gregarious personality wielded incredible influence as a main point of contact for U.S. Navy ships at ports across Asia.
His family’s ship servicing business, Singapore-based Glenn Defense Marine Asia Ltd. or GDMA, supplied food, water and fuel to vessels for decades.
He plied officers with Kobe beef, expensive cigars, concert tickets and wild sex parties at luxury hotels from Thailand to the Philippines.

In exchange, commanders passed him classified information and steered their ships, mostly from the Navy’s 7th Fleet, to ports he controlled so he could cover up as much as $35 million in fake charges.

Francis pleaded guilty in 2015 to offering prostitution services, luxury hotels, cigars, gourmet meals, and more than $500,000 in bribes to Navy officials and others to help his Singapore-based ship servicing company.
U.S. authorities also issued a red notice, which asks law enforcement worldwide to provisionally arrest someone with the possibility of extradition.
Malaysia and Singapore both have extradition agreements with the United States.
Francis had been allowed to remain in home confinement to receive medical care while he cooperated with the prosecution.
With his help, prosecutors secured convictions of 33 of 34 defendants, including more than two dozen Navy officers.
The judge repeatedly maintained that security guards must be on site for Francis to be on house arrest, despite his poor health.

According to a transcript of a closed-door hearing in February 2018, which was unsealed in January, Sammartino expressed concern that her name would come up if Francis escaped and ended up back in Malaysia if anyone asked “who let somebody do this without security.”
She raised similar concerns in a Dec. 17, 2020, after receiving a report that the home was left without anyone guarding it for nearly three hours, according to the court transcript.
The guard was on a lunch break, and Francis apologized to the judge for the mishap.

Officials found no security guards when they arrived at Francis' home in a tony San Diego neighborhood some seven hours after he removed the ankle monitor, according to Supervisory Deputy U.S. Marsha, Omar Castillo.
The device, believed to have been removed with heavy scissors, was found in the home.
Castillo said someone had called the San Diego police department, which sent officers to the home on the afternoon of Sept. 4.
Officers found the home empty and contacted U.S.
Pre-Trial Services, the federal agency in charge of his confinement, which then contacted the U.S. Marshals Service.

articles.outcome: Francis was taken into custody by Venezuelan authorities and will be handed over to federal authorities for extradition to the United States.

articles.title: 飓风菲奥娜前往百慕大，波多黎各多达8人死亡

sentences.content: 波多黎各圣胡安——飓风菲奥娜周三在多米尼加共和国和波多黎各开辟破坏性路径后向百慕大前进时增强为强大的 4 级风暴，风暴使大多数人断电，多达 8 人死亡。
周日在波多黎各登陆后，菲奥娜在岛上引发了毁灭性的洪水和山体滑坡。 在接下来的两天里，风暴聚集了多米尼加共和国和特克斯和凯科斯群岛。
美国国家飓风中心（NHC）表示，菲奥娜周三的风速高达每小时 130 英里（每小时 215 公里），预计随着向北向百慕大移动，风速会加强，但预计英国领土不会受到直接打击. Fiona 可能会在周五抵达加拿大的大西洋沿岸。
迈阿密NHC代理分部负责人埃里克布莱克表示，即使菲奥娜保持目前的路径并经过该岛西部，百慕大也会看到高海浪，风暴潮，强降雨和强风。 NHC表示，百慕大将在周四晚些时候看到最严重的风暴。
“希望风暴的核心将留在西部，但它仍可能向东慢跑并袭击百慕大，”布莱克说，并补充说，随着风暴向加拿大移动，美国东海岸将经历大浪和激流。
“这将是一件大事，”他告诉路透社，指的是菲奥娜前往加拿大大西洋省份新斯科舍省、纽芬兰和拉布拉多省的轨迹。
在波多黎各，岛上 330 万居民中有 40% 仍然没有水，四分之三的人没有电，当局正试图确定破坏的规模并开始重建。
国民警卫队分发水 2022 年 9 月 21 日，波多黎各庞塞飓风菲奥娜过后，波多黎各国民警卫队成员在受影响的社区分发水。（Ricardo Arduengo/路透社）
白宫在一份声明中说，总统乔拜登周三批准了波多黎各的灾难声明，该声明为受风暴影响的个人提供联邦资金。
法医科学研究所所长玛丽亚·康特·米勒博士在一次周二圆桌会议。 死亡人数正在调查中。
迄今为止，美国联邦紧急事务管理局已将波多黎各风暴造成四人死亡。 本周早些时候，瓜德罗普岛有第五人丧生。
对于许多波多黎各居民来说，2017 年的飓风玛丽亚仍然记忆犹新。 大约 3,000 人死于那场 5 级风暴，导致整个岛屿一周断电。
来自波多黎各西北部 Camuy 镇的 45 岁女售货员 Marylou Maldonado 表示，周二她的住所已恢复供水，但州长和能源供应商未能兑现他们恢复该地区电力供应的承诺。
“人们承受着很大的压力，”她说。 “在这个领域，危机是情绪化的。 由于没有电而感到沮丧，而且我们被骗了，这是情绪化的。”
据 LUMA Energy 称，截至周三中午，波多黎各估计仍有 107 万户家庭和企业停电，该公司表示，所有 150 万客户的全面恢复可能需要几天时间。
百慕大气象局已向位于美国北卡罗来纳州以东 600 英里（966 公里）的英国领土发布热带风暴警告。 它说，取决于风暴的路径，飓风强度的风是可能的。
该服务部副主任米歇尔·皮彻（Michelle Pitcher）表示，该国“就像一个从海洋中伸出的点”，没有保护海岸，这意味着严重的洪水更加危险。
即便如此，Pitcher 说，百慕大已经为 Fiona 为该岛准备的一切做好了准备。
“百慕大居民在为风暴做准备方面做得很好，”她说。 “我们建造坚固的房屋。”

articles.event: Damage and death caused by Hurricane Fiona
articles.where: Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, and Bermuda
articles.outcome: 8 deaths, widespread destruction, power outages, and flooding.

articles.title: Taufan Fiona cecah Kategori 4, menuju ke arah Bermuda

sentences.content: SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO – Taufan Fiona kini memasuki Kategori 4 hari ini ketika ia bergerak dari Kepulauan Turks dan Caicos menghala ke Bermuda, kata Pusat Taufan Kebangsaan (NHC).

“Laporan dari pesawat Rizab Tentera Udara Hurricane Hunter menunjukkan bahawa kelajuan angin maksimum kini menghampiri 210 kilometer sejam dengan tiupan lebih tinggi,” kata NHC sambil menambah, Fiona akan membadai Bermuda lewat esok (Khamis).
Taufan itu sebelum ini membadai Puerto Rico di mana sekurang-kurangnya dua orang terbunuh, lapor portal berita MailOnline semalam.

Taufan besar itu adalah yang pertama pada musim kali ini. Ia mencetuskan banjir kilat di Puerto Rico yang meragut nyawa seorang lelaki berusia 58 tahun selepas dihanyutkan oleh Sungai La Plata di belakang rumahnya di bandar Comerio, lapor CNN.

Ketika taufan itu menyebabkan lebih satu juta orang terputus bekalan elektrik atau air di wilayah Amerika Syarikat (AS) tersebut, lelaki kedua berusia 30-an dilaporkan maut selepas cuba menghidupkan generator di rumahnya.
Lebih 1,000 orang telah diselamatkan daripada banjir ketika pulau itu beransur pulih daripada kemusnahan akibat Taufan Maria yang melanda lima tahun lalu.

Kebanyakan kawasan di pulau itu berkemungkinan tidak mempunyai bekalan kuasa selama beberapa hari, demikian menurut pihak berkuasa yang bertungkus lumus membekalkan elektrik ke hospital dan perkhidmatan kecemasan.

Walaupun Taufan Fiona dijangka menuju ke utara ketika membadai pulau-pulau lain di Carribean sambil menjauhi tanah besar AS, NHC yang berpangkalan di Miami berkata, Puerto Rico dijangka menerima taburan hujan sehingga 20 sentimeter atau lebih pada minggu ini.
“Hujan akan terus menyebabkan banjir yang mengancam nyawa selain bencana banjir lumpur dan tanah runtuh di seluruh Puerto Rico,” kata NHC dalam satu kenyataan. – AFP/AGENSI

articles.event: Tropical Storm Fiona
articles.where: Puerto Rico, Turks and Caicos, Bermuda
articles.outcome: At least two deaths, power and water outages for over a million people, and flooding in Puerto Rico.

articles.title: Hurricane Fiona heads to Bermuda, up to eight dead in Puerto Rico

sentences.content: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico - Hurricane Fiona strengthened to a powerful Category 4 storm on Wednesday as it headed towards Bermuda after carving a destructive path through the Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico, where most were without power and up to eight people dead.
After making landfall in Puerto Rico on Sunday, Fiona caused devastating flooding and landslides on the island.
Over the next two days, the storm gathered steam as it barreled into the Dominican Republic and the Turks and Caicos Islands.

Eric Blake, acting branch chief for the NHC in Miami, said Bermuda would see high surf, storm surges, heavy rainfall and powerful winds even if Fiona kept on its current path and passed to the west of the island.

“Hopefully, the core of the storm will stay west, but it could still jog east and hit Bermuda,” Blake said, adding that the US East Coast would experience large swells and rip currents as the storm churns toward Canada.
“This will be a big deal up there,” he told Reuters, referring to Fiona’s track toward Canada’s Atlantic provinces of Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland and Labrador.

In Puerto Rico, where 40 per cent of the island's 3.3 million residents were still without water and three-fourths were lacking power, authorities were trying to get a handle on the scale of the destruction and start rebuilding.
US President Joe Biden on Wednesday approved a disaster declaration for Puerto Rico, which makes federal funding available for individuals affected by the storm, the White House said in a statement.
The US Federal Emergency Management Agency has so far attributed four deaths to the storm in Puerto Rico.
A fifth person was killed in Guadeloupe earlier in the week.
For many Puerto Rico residents, the memory of the devastation from Hurricane Maria in 2017 is still fresh.
Some 3,000 people died in that Category 5 storm, which left the entire island without electricity for a week.

Marylou Maldonado, 45, a saleswoman from the town of Camuy in northwestern Puerto Rico, said water was restored to her residence on Tuesday, but the governor and energy provider failed to fulfill their promise to restore power to her region.
"People are under a lot of stress," she said.
"Here in this area, the crisis is emotional.
It is emotional because of the frustration of not having electricity and that we are being lied to."

An estimated 1.07 million homes and businesses remained without power in Puerto Rico by midday on Wednesday, according to LUMA Energy, which has said full restoration to all 1.5 million customers could take several days.

The Bermuda Weather Service has issued a tropical storm warning for the archipelago, which lies over 900km east of the US state of North Carolina, as Fiona tracks to the west of the British Overseas Territory.
Hurricane-force winds are a possibility depending on the storm's path, it said.
Michelle Pitcher, deputy director of the service, said the country is “like a point sticking up out of the ocean” that had no protective shores, meaning severe flooding was more of a danger.
Even so, Pitcher said, Bermuda is ready for what Fiona has in store for the island.“

articles.event: Hurricane Fiona's path and impact
articles.where: Puerto Rico, Dominican Republic, Turks and Caicos Islands, Bermuda, US East Coast, Canada's Atlantic provinces of Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland and Labrador
articles.outcome: Devastating flooding and landslides in Puerto Rico, up to eight deaths, most without power and water, Bermuda facing high surf, storm surges, heavy rainfall, and powerful winds, US East Coast experiencing large swells and rip currents.

articles.title: Hurricane Fiona heads to Bermuda, up to 8 dead in Puerto Rico

sentences.content: SAN JUAN, Puerto Rico: Hurricane Fiona strengthened to a powerful Category 4 storm on Wednesday (Sep 21) as it headed toward Bermuda after carving a destructive path through the Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico, where the storm left most people without power and up to eight dead.
After making landfall in Puerto Rico on Sunday, Fiona caused devastating flooding and landslides on the island.
Over the next two days, the storm gathered steam as it barrelled into the Dominican Republic and the Turks and Caicos Islands.

Fiona packed winds as high as 215 kmh on Wednesday and was expected to strengthen as it moved north toward Bermuda, though no direct hit is forecast for the British territory, the US National Hurricane Center (NHC) said.
Fiona could reach Canada's Atlantic coast on Friday.

Eric Blake, acting branch chief for the NHC in Miami, said Bermuda would see high surf, storm surges, heavy rainfall and powerful winds even if Fiona kept on its current path and passed to the west of the island.
Bermuda will see the worst of the storm by late Thursday, the NHC said.

"Hopefully, the core of the storm will stay west, but it could still jog east and hit Bermuda," Blake said, adding that the US East Coast would experience large swells and rip currents as the storm churns toward Canada.
"This will be a big deal up there," he told Reuters, referring to Fiona's track toward Canada's Atlantic provinces of Nova Scotia, and Newfoundland and Labrador.

In Puerto Rico, where 40 per cent of the island's 3.3 million residents were still without water and three-fourths were lacking power, authorities were trying to determine the scale of the destruction and start rebuilding.

Fiona might have caused at least eight deaths, including that of a sick 4-month-old infant whose mother struggled to get to the hospital due to blocked roads, Dr Maria Conte Miller, director of the Institute of Forensic Sciences, said in at roundtable on Tuesday.
The deaths are under investigation.
The US Federal Emergency Management Agency has so far attributed four deaths to the storm in Puerto Rico.
A fifth person was killed in Guadeloupe earlier in the week.
For many Puerto Rico residents, the memory of Hurricane Maria in 2017 is still fresh.
About 3,000 people died in that Category 5 storm, which left the entire island without electricity for a week.

Marylou Maldonado, 45, a saleswoman from the town of Camuy in northwestern Puerto Rico, said water was restored to her residence on Tuesday, but that the governor and energy provider failed to fulfill their promise to restore power to her region.
"People are under a lot of stress," she said.
"Here in this area, the crisis is emotional.
It is emotional because of the frustration of not having electricity and that we are being lied to."

An estimated 1.07 million homes and businesses remained without power in Puerto Rico by midday on Wednesday, according to LUMA Energy, which has said full restoration to all 1.5 million customers could take several days.
The Bermuda Weather Service has issued a tropical storm warning for the British territory, 966km east of the US state of North Carolina.
Hurricane-force winds are a possibility depending on the storm's path, it said.
Michelle Pitcher, deputy director of the service, said the country is "like a point sticking up out of the ocean" that had no protective shores, meaning severe flooding was more of a danger.
Even so, Pitcher said, Bermuda is ready for what Fiona has in store for the island.
"Bermuda residents are very well practised in preparing for storms," she said.
"We build strong houses."

articles.event: Hurricane Fiona's impact on Puerto Rico and Bermuda
